title: Ticket #130: Review KVM patch
description:
From Ben K of Red Hat (I have the patch in my e-mail): 

Greg --

I have attached a patch that adds support for KVM in Condor. The patch is
a bit large, because it renames "XenType" to "VirshType," so a lot of lines
of patch are just simple one-liners. It also adds two new classes, XenType
(which differs from the previous XenType) and KVMType, with appropriate XML
generating code for each. The patch is based on the 7.2 branch.

Thank you for taking the time to review this.

-- Ben
remarks:
2009-Feb-23 00:34:20 by vmathew:
I went through the patch more as an attempt to understand the XEN/KVM implementation and code.

Overall, the patch looks good ! These are the comments and questions that I have..

1. From VMProc::Ckpt() it looks to me that checkpointing is not supported for KVM in this patch. Is that correct? If yes, is this because, KVM will write to the disk file even after a making a checkpoint rather than use a new file to store changeset? isn't there any way of doing a checkpointing?

2. Why is the call to checkXenParams() in VirshType::testXen() removed?

3. VMUniverseMgr::killVM(VMStarterInfo *info) @line 859 no case for "|| (strcasecmp(vmtype.Value(), CONDOR_VM_UNIVERSE_KVM) == 0)) {" Wondering if this was missed or was intentional.

4. CreateVirshConfigFile(): 4.1 As for the virshIOError() used to avoid the use of goto, I'd recommend having a virshFileWrite function, which will try to write the value and throw an exception if the wrtie fails. And then we can have the CreateVirshConfigFile() function have a try-catch clause. This can be done for both Xen and KVM.

4.2 Also, Can there only be one network interface for virsh/xen/kvm?

5. If I understand the patch correctly, configuration values of KVM are still named with "XEN" as prefix. (this is repeated below in the cosmetic comments, but I think we'll have to fix this before release).

--- cosmetic comments ---

Error Messages need to be altered to include KVM also. else user who submitted KVM job gets an error talking of xen. Likewise with some member names, config parameters etc too. - xen_type.h The file, and the member function with Xen in the name may be renamed.

XenType::CreateConfigFile The comments/errors have been edited to say virsh, but they actually need not be, since this is now in XenType class.

2009-Feb-23 14:19:32 by tannenba:
For better or worse, throwing C++ exceptions is currently against Condor's coding guidelines. Perhaps we wanna revisit that, but for now structured exceptions are not permitted.

2009-Feb-23 14:22:05 by tannenba:
Thanks Varghese. Next up to the review plate is Jaime, then Ben will have all the feedback he needs for a round of edits before we merge it into the code.

2009-Feb-28 19:37:50 by bkreuter:
vmatthew:

1. Checkpointing in KVM is beyond the scope of this patch. As a future direction, we might want to look at using the "QCOW" disk image format that KVM can use, which is a copy-on-write scheme. The idea would be to suspend the VM, and while it was suspended, use its current disk image as the base for a new QCOW image, which would then be swapped in. I am not sure how feasible that is. If there is a better way to do checkpointing, I am open to it.

2. The call was not removed, it was relocated. The reason is that it is a static function, but still needs to be specialized on the type of VM we are creating (KVM should check for the existence of /dev/kvm, for example). Since we cannot use dynamic dispatch, I moved to call up one level, to the client code for VirshType::testXen.

3. That was a mistake, thanks for catching it.

4. Someone else pointed out that exceptions are not used in Condor, so I will not touch this right now.

4.2 Can you clarify this?

5. Yes, that is something that should be fixed. Unfortunately, changing the names of configuration values right now would break existing installations, so it is something that will have to happen later. KVM and Xen share several configuration values, so it does not really make sense for two sets of configuration values to be maintained.

--

I will wait for Jaime's comments, then send an updated patch.
